content.description: SDS on the low ledge, shoot up to the right for another ledge then work up to the topout. Topout is sketchy so make sure you've checked the top access before sending.  Arete and large slabby block at the bottom right of the boulder are off. Newly climbed problem with some hollow holds.
content.location: Tallest line on the boulder to the left of the obvious arete.

content.description: Stand start with sloping pocket and good crimp to the left. Move up to the sloping crimp rail and then throw to the top and topout. Big blocks at bottom of boulder are off, use the low ledge for feet. Possible to be done statically with bad feet.
content.location: Start to the left of "Scumby" on the pocket and crimp.

content.description: SDS matched with fingers in horizontal crack. Stand up on decent footholds and climb into the stand-start. Big blocks in front of the boulder off.
content.location: Start below and to the left of "Scumby" in thin crack.

content.description: Same start as "Lurkin", but climb directly straight up into sloping holds. Topout to the right of Lurkin. Use Lurkin holds as feet. Best line on the boulder.
content.location: Same start as "Lurkin". Climbs in between "Lurkin" and "Scumby".

content.description: Slightly overhanging boulder with some of the smoothest rock in the area but comes with some hollow holds. While there are hollow holds there is some solid rock that forms two noticeable lines. Keep in mind that it's unsafe to topout "Scumby" as there are loose rocks above the main section of the wall.
